newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Seoul stocks close lower on consolidation.
newsitem.headline: Seoul stocks close lower on consolidation.

text.p: South Korean stocks ended Saturday's half-day trading session lower as a consolidation eclipsed earlier sharp gains, brokers said.
The composite stock index lost 2.90 points to 762.77 after earlier hitting a new yearlly high of 775.15.
"The market took a rest following recent steep rises," said analyst Hwang Chang-joong of LG Securities.
"But the underlying market sentiment remains very strong, bolstered by falling interest rates and the strenthening yen."
Yields on benchmark three-year corporate bonds hit a new 1997 low of 11.52 percent on Thursday.
The South Korean stock and debt markets were closed on Friday for a national Memorial Day holiday.
Brokers said investors were pinning hopes on the local economy recovering sooner than many had earlier anticipated. Such expectations were spurring active foreign buying, they added.
"The consolidation is expected to continue early next week but the marekt will rise further toward the weekend," Hwang said. "I'm sure the market is riding a bull-run."
